### Socioeconomic and Structural Determinants for Voter Turnout
**Georgetown University - DSAN 5100**

A comprehensive statistical analysis investigating whether socioeconomic pressures—unemployment, housing affordability, crime rates, and cost of living—predict voter participation more than civic duty. Analyzing 23 elections (1980-2024) across six states using advanced statistical methods including ANOVA, time series forecasting, and bootstrap resampling to uncover what really drives Americans to vote.

**Technologies:** R, Python, Quarto

[View Project →](https://nko123.github.io/DSAN-5100-Final-Project/)

### The Menendez Brothers: From Courtrooms to Comments Sections
**Georgetown University**

A data science exploration tracing how public discourse around the Menendez brothers transformed across 35 years—from their 1989 crime through their sensationalized trials to the Netflix era. This project analyzes media narratives across multiple platforms, revealing fundamental shifts in how American society understands family violence, male victimization, and criminal justice reform.

**Technologies:** Python, NLP, Text Analysis, Data Visualization, Social Media Analytics

[View Project →](https://nkemokweye.georgetown.domains/fall-2025-project-no252-gu/)
:::
